ED22D450B7294B96893E642A667C42D4.description: Practice following oral directions and taking notes.

1446A4C76969439C8627027C3A126ADD.description: Performance Skills: Practice and use oral communication skills. This includes the following:

6713D2DBEB124D4C854CB963C4B8B415.description: Have confidence, make eye contact and use your space

CD9304AA768C48A194C59E1FA7A28ABA.description: Speak clearly using projection to reach the back row

1CC874D3943F40DCBE6DEF13AEAEEE43.description: Prepare thoroughly and plan your message

C32F75383390423D97B1701989A834DF.description: Understand how to create an effective spoken presentation

A028F4FCB9854E1789D0C548E13B629D.description: Cadence: rhythmic flow of a sequence of sounds or words, including pauses.

176D830516BF475494278DA43A00DAE6.description: Tone: is the inflection, the rise and fall of the sound, such as ending a question in a higher pitch. Often conveys specific emotions to the listener. Can include volume.

C0D28624DF844242947349EFB8731025.description: Enunciation: to pronounce a word clearly; articulating every syllable of the word

E8B56E390871464B9E0A0108072D2A2F.description: Pronunciation: how you say a word. This includes emphasizing different syllables, words, or phrases. Pronunciation can vary based on geography or tradition.

C595DF3F4EA24E839F97F337858C7947.description: Understand correct use of the following components/characteristics of spoken language

B6168A7942684687AF7A0797F8D624D5.description:
Communication Skills- Students will develop and practice effective spoken communication skills.

Spoken Communication- refers to the production of spoken language to send an intentional message to a listener, especially in contrast to using gestures or mannerisms (non-verbal communication).

7974EC8A90A34D0F88BE9E76A4088FEA.description: Give a specific example of a communication barrier in business

32CD6823DB0F4D8A9BF1D872E75E2CC1.description: Demonstrate how altering non-verbal communication can change a message.

9259A32AB1AB4DFDB69D9ED11EEA1B2A.description: Performance Skills (choose one): Demonstrate nonverbal communication. This includes the following:

B26DF9A26FBF4D2AA8BA662BE596E2A3.description: Recognize the effect of nonverbal communication

E8A2EDD061484E7A9BF9154F3F688C98.description: Nonverbal communication is the transfer of information through the use of body language including eye contact, facial expressions, gestures and more.

083BE63CF8A447A7BC1A87B94D40EB47.description: Effective communication includes recognizing non-verbal cues, choosing the message, and recognizing barriers to communication. Students will identify and demonstrate effective non-verbal communication.

4FD27A9DF72248AB8B93F92AC3770A56.description: Tailor a presentation to an audience

E335EE6FD3CF452E85ABC6BDDE338331.description: Performance Skills: Create a presentation on any subject that shows the following

6C542327CABC4C5BBE1703B6CF3C8D01.description: Use bias-free language to develop responsible ways of thinking and acting. Bias-free language does not discriminate and therefore includes all audience members in a fair and friendly manner.

53B82F4F1A9A40558B6D261D0B8CCD1C.description: Technology barriers: any miscommunication caused by technology integration, slow internet, lack of training on technology or other technology based interferences.

27829AED60EB4D149C1830BDD5EC68E0.description: Psychological barriers: the influence of the psychological state of the communicators (sender and receiver) which creates an obstacle for effective communication.

FBE9756E69F347AD8C321B66882B5C7E.description: Cultural barriers: an issue arising from a misunderstanding of meaning, caused by cultural differences between sender and receiver.

16F815A196D143F5B54167738F534833.description: Language barriers: Obstacles like the lack of knowledge of a specific language that obstructs communication.

031177FD5BD24ACD8A550D0648BC0398.description: Physiological barriers: the limitations of the human body and the human mind (memory, attention, and perception)

06AFBC2F8D804C43AA07DCD0829DCAD9.description: Physical barriers: an element or a physical factor that acts as a distraction to hinder the flow of communication

E0D5A5A69B044695AC4EC8AF9AEA414E.description: Organizational barriers: the hindrances in the flow of information among the employees that might result in a commercial failure of an organization.

1D2A9F8A2CF44CC0A571D59AF1A9A084.description: How appearances (visual aides and dress for example) impact message

8192D93AC4364C1191E5F827A8B0B472.description: Recognize when to use communication channels based on audience

93B31573279945F7A914EEEC3EB10FBD.description: Understand and identify how the audience and situation affects style and tone.

5E3148DB59564D9982840EB888132A12.description: Recognizing the purpose of a message

0AC1FDC67FED4646AF2C0914B94E6AAD.description: Effective communication-Students will understand that effective communication results in the receiver understanding the intended message.
